poem:
Title: Puppetry in the House

Ashcroft, a puppeteer subtle and sly,
While Starmer and Sunak battle and pry,
Within the Parliament's vigorous fray,
Truss and Rayner serve in the play.
Their words, a dance choreographed with care,
Opinions waved about in the air.
Yet, in the background, Ashcroft sits tight,
Steering the dialogue day and night.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Hoopla around Truss and Rayner shows Michael Ashcroft still steering the debate If this week’s tetchy exchanges between Keir Starmer and Rishi Sunak at prime minister’s questions proved one thing, it was the ability of the veteran businessman, donor and publisher Michael Ashcroft to set the political agenda. While Starmer revelled in the publication of 10 Years to Save the West, which was written by the former prime minister Liz Truss and published this week". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
